results.title: Victoria
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Rich in history and culture, Victoria also boasts a fine selection of food and spectacular natural landscapes. Melbourne’s main attractions open the program including trams, tree-lined boulevards, splendid buildings and magnificent gardens. Its country and coastal regions offer visitors a diverse range of activities from horse riding in the Great Dividing Ranges, experiencing the gold rush at Sovereign Hill, ‘cruising’ Lake Eildon, visiting Flagstaff Hill Maritime Museum, relaxing at Daylesford and Hepburn Springs, rock-climbing at Mount Arapiles and for the gourmet traveller a residential cooking school at Howqua Dale.

results.title: Old enough but not ready: early recognition of learning disabilities
results.creator_credit: Barrie Angus McLean and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Learning Series”.
Derek behaves as if he had difficulty uttering words; Eugene is unable to follow verbal instructions such as “left”, “first, “after”; Mark has yet to use his hands as though the fingers are ten distinct elements. Children of six and seven who are bright and cheerful but for various reasons are not yet able to cope with the demands made in a Grade One classroom. Dr. Sam Rabinovitch explains the advantage of early recognition of learning disabilities in children. Shows the learning and teaching difficulties of these children.

results.title: King Island
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Jack Absalom’s outback Australia series”.
At the western end of treacherous Bass Strait King Island is noted in the history books for the frequency of shipwrecks on its rocky shores. But in recent times it is getting a reputation for the quality of its tender beef and gourmet cheese…not to mention the “characters” that the so called “forgotten” island has attracted in recent years. Jack Absalom found it one of the most friendly places he’d visited and concluded that its name should be changed to “the Magic Island”.

results.title: I'm not too famous at it: a definition of learning disabilities
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson, Barrie Angus McLean and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Learning Series”.
The title was named by Robert, a bright nine year old, who lacks eye-hand coordination, has difficulty appreciating the characteristics of shapes and forms, has language difficulties of various kinds, who has poor gross motor coordination and other problems. While defining and describing these learning deficits indirectly shows somthing of the process of remediation.

results.title: Jewels of the Kimberley
results.creator_credit: Mitch Matthews, Rio and Rhonda Mabey
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Jack Absalom’s outback Australia series”.
The original jewels in the Kimberley in Australia’s far north west were the hardy pioneer cattlemen and women who crossed the Continent with their herds to establish themselves as Kings in Grass Castles. They were followed by gold prospectors and farmers who opened up the mighty Ord River Irrigation Scheme. The newest jewels are diamonds. They were discovered by the new prospectors who are now reaping rich rewards for the millions of dollars they spent prospecting for their jewels. Rated: G

results.title: Western Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Experience the highlights of Western Australia beginning with the wildlife and good food at Margaret River, visit the Pinnacles, enjoy a range of sporting activities at Merribrook, join a cattle muster at El Questro or a novelty gypsy caravan tour, explore the Spanish architecture at New Norcia - the country town built to bring christianity to the Aborigines, visit the Pilbara and picturesque Broome or board a yacht to explore remote sections of Western Australia’s spectacular coastline.

results.title: Taxi
results.creator_credit: Gerard Pires, Laurent Petin, Michael Petin and ARP-TF1 Films
results.brief_description: An upbeat and entertaining film from director Gerard Pires where the tale of charismatic and grandiose Daniel, a former pizza delivery boy turned taxi driver extraodinaire, is woven into the tragi-comic life of Emilien, an unsuccessful, down trodden policeman on a near hopeless search for illusive German bank robbers. The son of a rally car driver, with driving skills that seemingly defy the realms of possibility with his speed crazy efforts in a custom modified car brimming with gadgetry, Daniel unsuspectingly picks up Emilien from his mother’s house and inevitably sets out to give him a high-speed ride. Consequently, Daniel is forced to accept a deal as a driver and assistant detective for Emilien to avoid becoming a permanent pedestrian. So, from stages of ineptitude and absurdity the investigation into the German bank robbers continues but this time with Daniel uncomfortably placed on the other side of the law but nevertheless becoming a crucial mastermind along with Emilien in the pursuit of the bank robbers. With the help of a parade of pizza delivery boys, Daniel’s trusty taxi, the amiably long suffering women in both their lives and a little messing with envious egos the unlikely pair take the uncrackable case to its longed for conclusion. Cast includes Samy Naceri, Frederic Diefenthal, Marion Cotillard and Manuella Gourary. Spoken in French with English subtitles.

results.title: Tasmania's wild west
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Jack Absalom’s outback Australia series”.
Just eleven years before European settlement at Sydney Cove, Port Jackson, Captain James Cook had his only real meeting with Australian Aborigines at Bruny Island just off the southern coast of Tasmania. It was a meeting destined to change the fate of two distinct groups in the human race.

results.title: Rainbow's End
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Jack Absalom’s outback Australia series”.
Every goldrush seems to begin with stories of people, picking up nuggets by the handful. This is a nostalgic journey to the richest square mile of real estate in the world. Jack Absalom traces the “Golden Rainbow” that the early diggers followed on their quest that would set them up for life. Rated: G
